decks.notes: This Jeskai Control deck focuses on controlling the game by countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures to outvalue the opponent and protect its own life total. The deck aims to control the board until it can resolve powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to close out the game. With a combination of efficient removal and powerful finishers, this deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast its opponents in a grindy, attrition-based matchup.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with tax effects like Thoughtseize and Flickerwisp. It also has a strong removal package with Fatal Push and Solitude. The deck seeks to control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent to secure a quick victory. It utilizes a mix of creatures with unique abilities, such as Aven Interrupter and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, to keep the opponent on their toes and make it difficult for them to stabilize.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy with a combination of hand disruption, counterspells, and removal spells while also utilizing graveyard recursion. It aims to control the game through card advantage and efficient removal, with a win condition in the form of maintaining board presence with creatures like Murktide Regent. The deck is designed to counter threats and out-maneuver opponents until it can establish a dominant position on the board and close out the game.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. The deck uses control elements such as Glaring Fleshraker, Karn, the Great Creator, and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, it includes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also features cards like Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust to further control the board and maintain dominance over the game.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco to deal damage to the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Tribal Flames to further pressure the opponent. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provide support in controlling the opponent's board while Stubborn Denial offers protection for key threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to efficiently cast its powerful spells and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End, while also utilizing equipment like Blade of the Bloodchief to boost their power. It combines cards like Ancient Stirrings and Urza's Saga to search for key pieces of the combo, while also using disruptors like Malevolent Rumble to control the board. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and powerful equipment synergies.

This deck revolves around sacrificing creatures like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to generate mana and trigger abilities from cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Kozilek's Command. By utilizing Eldrazi creatures and powerful artifacts, the goal is to create a powerful combo that overwhelms the opponent quickly. The deck also includes cards like Urza's Saga and Ancient Stirrings to search for key pieces and maintain consistency. Overall, the strategy is to create a synergistic engine that can quickly build a board presence and close out the game before the opponent can react effectively.

This UW Control deck focuses on using a variety of control spells and planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing extra cards and maintaining board control. It aims to counter or remove threats, generate card advantage, and ultimately outvalue the opponent in the late game. The deck includes powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Solitude, along with a mix of counterspells and removal spells to control the game. Additionally, the deck features lands that provide different utility options to adapt to different matchups.

This deck focuses on using artifact creatures and artifacts to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga, the deck can quickly generate threats and overwhelm the opponent. With an emphasis on tempo and disruption, cards like Metallic Rebuke and Thought Monitor help control the game while maintaining pressure. The goal is to establish a board presence early and maintain momentum throughout the game, using a combination of efficient creatures and powerful artifacts to secure victory.

The main focus of this Esper Control deck is to maintain control of the game through counterspells and removal spells while also disrupting your opponent's strategy. The deck includes a mix of creature removal, counter spells, card draw, and various threats to control the board state. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently dealing with their threats while maintaining a steady stream of card advantage. Building up to powerful finishers like Murktide Regent or Harbinger of the Seas helps the deck close out the game once it has established control.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with the Broodscale subtype to create a powerful combo with Blade of the Bloodchief and Malevolent Rumble, allowing for quick and devastating board control. It also includes various support cards like Ancient Stirrings and Urza's Saga to help find the key pieces of the combo quickly. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an explosive combination of synergistic cards, leading to a swift victory.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Broodscale Bloodchief and other key cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Malevolent Rumble to create a threatening board state. The deck utilizes Ancient Stirrings and Urza's Saga to search for and tutor key pieces, while also utilizing strong support cards like Walking Ballista and Eldrazi Temple to control the board and ramp up mana. The inclusion of cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Boseiju, Who Endures provide additional versatility and resilience to the deck's game plan.

The main idea of this Grixis Control deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. By using cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to keep the opponent's threats in check while slowly building up its own board presence. Cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Psychic Frog provide card advantage and additional ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By efficiently controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent, this deck can grind out victories through attrition and careful decision-making.

This deck focuses on quickly getting Griselbrand into the graveyard and then reanimating him with Goryo's Vengeance to draw a large number of cards. Using cards like Ephemerate and Psychic Frog to filter through the deck, the deck aims to find the combo pieces quickly and efficiently. Utilizing cards like Tainted Indulgence and Solitude for disruption, the deck aims to control the game while setting up the combo. A combination of instant reanimation and card draw allows the deck to quickly assemble its win condition and overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, utilizing planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes removal spells like Solitude and Supreme Verdict to deal with threats on the board. Narset, Parter of Veils provides additional card advantage while Prismatic Ending can deal with a variety of permanents. The deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can win through incremental advantage or a big threat like Monumental Henge.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing creatures with powerful abilities and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to maintain a strong board presence while controlling the opponent's resources, using cards like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply pressure and disrupt their game plan. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's strategy, allowing the aggressive creatures to push through for a decisive victory.
